title: Calories in a Negroni
meta_description: Discover calories in a negroni, including carbs, sugars, and full nutrition breakdown for this classic cocktail, plus tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Standard recipe: 30 ml gin, 30 ml Campari, 30 ml sweet vermouth; stirred over ice, strained; no added sugar or garnish calories.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, exact measurements, and preparation; alcohol content affects totals. Consult labels for specific ingredients.

quick_answer.text: A standard negroni contains about 260 kcal, primarily from alcohol and sugars in the vermouth and Campari.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 oz soda water for fizz (diluted version)
Double the Campari for bitter twist

faqs.q: How many calories in a negroni cocktail?
faqs.a: Approximately 260 kcal for a standard 90 ml serving.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a negroni?
faqs.a: About 20 g carbs, mostly sugars from the vermouth and Campari.

faqs.q: Does a negroni have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: No significant protein or fat; calories come from alcohol and carbs.

faqs.q: How does preparation affect calories in a negroni?
faqs.a: Shaken vs. stirred has minimal impact; added syrups or garnishes increase calories.
Yes, using diet vermouth or less Campari can reduce totals by 50+ kcal.
